data.title: AnimatedSprite always starts and never stops playing when node processing is enabled
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 custom build. Linux 64 bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I add an AnimatedSprite to a scene and it is set to be processing, it always plays, even when the playing property is set to false, and even stopping it from a script doesn't do anything. Note that this doesn't happen when the node is not set to be processing.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a new scene and add an AnimatedSprite
- Add a new SpriteFrames resource to it with a few frames.
- Add a script to the AnimatedSprite node. Write set_process(true) into _ready().
- Make sure that the "playing" property is not checked.
- Run the scene and see that the sprite is animating.
- Calling self.stop() (even in _process) doesn't help, the animation never stops.

data.title: Adapt mouse pad navigation for Mac OSX
data.body:
Mac OSX El Capitán
Godot v2.0.3.stable.oficial

Mouse pad navigation in mac osx works with pinch for zooming in or out, and double finger for panning/scrolling. However, Godot does not use this convention, instead using double finger for zooming. That makes the zoom very sensitive, and quite clunkier to use when compared to other systems. This also means that panning doesn't work using just the pad, and you have to use spacebar+click to pan, which is harder. It would be nice if the convention was used, for the sake of user-friendliness.

data.title: Implement undo/redo for adding and deleting global properties
Shader's TIME is not being affected by global time scale
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux / 2.0.3

**Issue description**
A shader's `TIME` variable is not being affected by `OS.set_time_scale()`.
I don't know if this is by design, but I think when I set a global time scale, it should affect everything.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a shader that makes use of `TIME` and change time scale via `OS.set_time_scale()`

data.title: Strange behaviour of collision shapes
data.body:
Windows 8.1, Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I was playing around with some collision shapes, 'cause I had a bug in my game: a destroyable box stood on a static body. Both of them had a collision shape, the box had a capsule-shape and the static body a sphere shape. So I tried other shapes to fix the bug and I noticed a strange behaviour: 
A capsule shape stays on a capsule shape.
A capsule shape stays on a sphere shape. 
But a box-shape falls from a sphere or capsule shape. It looks kinda wrong to me, if you would put a ball on a ball, the ball shouldn't stay on top of the other. Same with capsules.

Steps to reproduce:
Make a new scene, create some testcubes, giv'em some shapes and play around.

data.title: A function to change parent
data.body:
A function to change parent could be useful
Node.change_parent(ParentNode)

There is a workaround to Node.add_child(Node) then Node.quee_free() the old one, but it will loose all its instanced values.

data.title: Mesh import plugin: unused generate_tangents option?
64 bit Godot crashes when adding 3D Camera to scene (Intel drivers bug on Windows 7)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Windows 7 x64
Intel HD 4000 graphics
Tested with 64 bit Godot 2.0.1, 2.0.2 and 2.0.3

**Issue description:**

On a Windows 7 x64 system using Intel HD 4000 graphics, 64 bit Godot crashes when adding a 3D camera to the scene, or selecting an existing 3D camera and zooming away from it.

A crash does not occur when using 32 bit Godot.
A crash does not occur when using 32 or 64 bit Godot on a system without Intel HD 4000 graphics.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1) Add a 3D Camera to a scene
OR
2) Select an existing 3D camera and zoom out/away from it

data.title: Still Having This Error: editor_resource_preview.cpp(361) : error C4716: 'EditorResourcePreview::check_for_invalidation': must return a value
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro. Latest compiled from the GitHub repo. 

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When compiling with Microsoft's Visual C++ compiler (both 32-bit and 64-bit), compilation fails with error 

```
godot\tools\editor\editor_resource_preview.cpp(361) : error C4716: 'EditorResourcePreview::check_for_invalidation': must return a value
scons: *** [tools\editor\editor_resource_preview.windows.opt.tools.64.obj] Error 2
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
1.  Pull the latest source from GitHub.
2. Try to compile.

data.title: Improve quick open sorting
data.body:
Perfect matches and substrings will be shown first. Similar matches will
be at the bottom. When they score is the same they're shown in the natural
file system order.

The natural file system order shows upper-case names before lower-case.

data.title: Add usual typing shortcut keys for Mac OSX
data.body:
Mac OSX El Capitán
Godot v2.0.3.stable.oficial

Typing in text editors in Godot needs more shortcut support when using a Mac OSX keyboard. Things like using control key in regular keyboards and jumping through words doesn't work anywhere in Godot. Mac keyboards use the alt key for that, and the command+directional jumps to the end of the line (works like both home and end keys in regular keyboards). This is not only for the code editor, but for editing node names and other attributes that require typing.

I looked for a similar issue and couldn't find one. I am sorry in advance if this is a duplicate.

data.title: Ability to send mouse and key events to OS.
data.body: Recently needed this, and for a legitimate use, but Godot doesn't seems to offer it. It would be awesome to be able to simulate mouse/key presses and its combinations (Ctrl+C).

data.title: Add android_add_default_config for config.py
data.body:
usage : `env.android_add_default_config("applicationId 'com.godot.game'")`

This can put more setting to defaultConfig section in build.gradle, such as `applicationId 'com.godot.game'`
fixes #5251

data.title: Directory Object broken on Windows 10
data.body:
The Directory Object appears to be broken on Windows again. :(

Windows 10, Godot version 2.0.2 - 2.0.3

Attempting to check if a directory exists will always return FALSE, even if the folder/directory was just created. 

Steps to reproduce - check example program below.

http://pastebin.com/b6PEEBwi

data.title: Fix Object::get_property_list biding to include variables for all scripts
Provide key combination to automatically abort execution of a Godot-built program.
data.body: Adventure Game Studio provides a key combination - ALT+X - that will halt the running (game) executable at any time. Perhaps Godot should provide something similar, at least for debugging purposes.

data.title: include("res://script.gd") function
data.body: It could be really useful to part a code in several files, just like PHP include() function http://php.net/manual/en/function.include.php

data.title: Update String.capitalize() documentation
data.body: Old one was probably for to_upper()

data.title: "unused variable" warning types needing discussion before they're fixed
data.body:
When compiling Godot with GCC 5.4.0, we get tons of `[-Wunused-variable]` and `[-Wunused-but-set-variable]` warnings for this kind of things:

```
drivers/chibi/cp_loader_s3m.cpp: In member function 'CPLoader::Error CPLoader_S3M::load_sample(CPSample*)':
drivers/chibi/cp_loader_s3m.cpp:147:7: warning: unused variable 'dsk' [-Wunused-variable]
   int dsk=file->get_byte();
       ^
drivers/chibi/cp_loader_s3m.cpp:148:7: warning: unused variable 'pack' [-Wunused-variable]
   int pack=file->get_byte();
       ^
```

In our various loaders in `drivers/`, we quite often use `int some_var_that_will_never_be_used = file->get_byte();` just to move further while decoding the file.

It's not a big deal, but getting rid of these warnings would be nice. What would be the good practice in such a case? Just invoke `file->get_byte(); // pack` without assigning its return value?

Suggestions welcome, then I can handle the fix for all occurrences (there are quite a few).

data.title: AtlasTextures don't work with Patch9Frames (and related GUI skinning)
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.3 and 66d513bb2ab86ab75d727cce031cfb226501cab4, Windows 10 64 bits

My GUI is skinned from a single atlas image, so I want to use AtlasTextures in my theme.
However it doesn't respects the texture region :(
This is the case on every GUI element that can be skinned using the 9-patch approach, and it forced me to use separate textures everytime.
Is this intented, or is it a bug?

Example project:
[Patch9FramesAtlas.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/348724/Patch9FramesAtlas.zip)

![atlas_texture_not_working](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/16601450/dae14d3c-430c-11e6-809d-ee4f1fd72751.png)

data.title: Object::get_property_list don't include script variables in References
data.body:
**Issue description**:
The function `Object::get_property_list` don't include export and normal script variables, on GDScript classes that extends directly from `Reference`. The same seems to happens on classes that inherit from `Object`. But for example when the script extends from `Resource` the function works normally.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Run the example project.
2. Press the "Reference" button (Empty output).
3. Press the "Resource" button, the variables appears on the output, event if the only difference between the two scripts is the inheritance.

**Link to minimal example project**:
[reference_property.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/348710/reference_property.zip)

data.title: Multimesh.set_instance_color() don't seems to work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 alpha, 628b0a9375814bc811820f073df5f102bdb049fc commit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Apparently `Multimesh.set_instance_color()`  don't seems to work. I looked at c++ code and I found place where it's used in `rasterizer_gles2.cpp`: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp#L2997 it seems in this line multimesh is added to `_multimesh_dirty_list` which is later resolved at: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp#L4278
I'm not sure but it looks like the color information is not used at the place where he is resolving `_multimesh_dirty_list`. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Setup our own multimesh instance and use `set_instance_color` method
OR
1. Download sample project
2. Open `MeshParticles.tscn`
3. Run

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[MultimeshTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/348634/MultimeshTest.zip)

data.title: Fix documentation constants sorting
data.body:
Adding a list of constants (under debug mode) to VariantCall so the constants of built-in types can be sorted in the order of registering.

Also removing the manual sorting of constants in doc_data so the doctool keeps the constants in natural order.

Closes #5512.

data.title: Respect frame property when converting to TileSet.
data.body:
Adjusted tile regions based on specified frame property.
Closes #2430

data.title: Fixed HQ2x compiler warnings
data.body:
Changes upstream are in progress, see [PR](https://github.com/brunexgeek/hqx/pull/1).

fixes #5509

data.title: Samplelibrary size
data.body:
Added `SampleLibrary.size()` and `SampleLibrary.get_sample_names()`
fixes #5556 

EDIT: Changed to `SampleLibrary.get_sample_count()`

data.title: Add OS.request_attention() for Windows
data.body:
This makes the taskbar icon flash to request user attention.

On OSX there's the [`NSApplication.requestUserAttention()`](https://developer.apple.com/reference/appkit/nsapplication/1428358-requestuserattention?language=objc) function that does a similar job (makes the dock icon bounce), but I don't know Objective-C nor do I have a Mac to test it.

I found nothing about this for Linux though...

Related to #3292.

data.title: Input: add get_connected_joysticks() method.
data.body: fixes #5465

data.title: Export to Android S6 Edge makes view extra small
data.body:
Device and Godot version:

```
Samsung S6 Edge
Android 5.1.1
5.1" Quad HD(2560x1440) 577ppi, Super AMOLED Dual edge
Godot Engine v2.1.alpha.custom_build (05/07/2016)
```

Issue:
The screen shows things extra small, show the next errors on ADB console:

```
I/godot   (11485): ERROR: expand_x2_hq2x: Condition ' format>=FORMAT_INDEXED ' is true.
I/godot   (11485):    At: core/image.cpp:906.
I/godot   (11485): ERROR: expand_x2_hq2x: Condition ' format>=FORMAT_INDEXED ' is true.
I/godot   (11485):    At: core/image.cpp:906.
I/godot   (11485): ERROR: expand_x2_hq2x: Condition ' format>=FORMAT_INDEXED ' is true.
I/godot   (11485):    At: core/image.cpp:906.
I/godot   (11485): ERROR: expand_x2_hq2x: Condition ' format>=FORMAT_INDEXED ' is true.
I/godot   (11485):    At: core/image.cpp:906.
I/godot   (11485): ERROR: expand_x2_hq2x: Condition ' format>=FORMAT_INDEXED ' is true.
I/godot   (11485):    At: core/image.cpp:906.
I/godot   (11485): ERROR: expand_x2_hq2x: Condition ' format>=FORMAT_INDEXED ' is true.
I/godot   (11485):    At: core/image.cpp:906.
I/godot   (11485): ERROR: expand_x2_hq2x: Condition ' format>=FORMAT_INDEXED ' is true.
I/godot   (11485):    At: core/image.cpp:906.
```

Engine.cfg:

```
[application]

name="Bouncer"
main_scene="res://menu/Menu.tscn"
boot_splash="res://splash.png"
icon="res://icon.png"

[display]

width=1280
height=720
orientation="landscape"
driver="GLES2"

[editor]

main_run_args="$exec -path $path -scene $scene $main_scene"

[locale]

translations=["res://translations/translations.en.xl", "res://translations/translations.es.xl"]
fallback=" en_US"

[render]

mipmap_policy=2
default_clear_color=#fffafafa
```

I play with this params but nothing change:

```
allow_hidpi=true
use_hidpi_theme=true
```

data.title: Ability to change font size in RichTextLabel without requiring separate font resources when using DynamicFont
data.body:
Having a [size=(font height in pixels)] tag for changing the font size (when using a DynamicFont) without requiring separate font resources for each size would be very helpful for things like titles.

Perhaps the font height should be settable using a percentage as well, which would then be relative to the default font size of the RichTextLabel.
